result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabrina L Talley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Racine County.
Concurrent with: Count 8.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with Christopher J.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sabrina L Talley in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  

State moves to amend count 1.
Amended information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 6 & 8.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 6 & 8.
Count 7 is dismissed as a read-in.

Court orders the following:
Count 6:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.


Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to count 8.
Court will allow transfer to Racine County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Christopher Jennings.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


Costs: $243
DNA Surcharge: Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
 
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.




Count 8:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to count 6.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to count 6.
Court will allow for transfer to Racine County.
Conditions of Probation:
Same as count 6.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Sabrina L Talley in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of her release.

Defendant Sabrina L Talley in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
